title: 112_hr6397
content: The Act titled "Defending American Taxpayers From Abusive Government Takings Act of 2012" prohibits the use of eminent domain power. The Act "Defending American Taxpayers From Abusive Government Takings Act of 2012" prohibits Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac from purchasing mortgages secured by properties obtained through eminent domain in the past 10 years. The Act prohibits Freddie Mac from purchasing mortgages secured by properties obtained through eminent domain in the past 10 years, including any residential structure or dwelling unit within the same county. The National Housing Act is amended to include a definition of "mortgage" that encompasses first and subordinate mortgages on residential structures or dwelling units. The National Housing Act is amended to prohibit the Secretary from insuring mortgages secured by properties obtained through eminent domain in the past 10 years. The National Housing Act prohibits the use of eminent domain to secure mortgages insured by the Secretary within the last 10 years. The Secretary is prohibited from guaranteeing loans for residences in counties where eminent domain was used to secure a mortgage in the past 10 years. Definitions for "residential mortgage loan" and "State" are provided in this section.
